page.title: 18A DAY IN THE LIFE OF
page.content: I'm one of five children of a farmer. My day begins at 7.30, when I'm woken up. I wash, dress and have breakfast by 8 o'clock. Then we all go outside to wait for the school taxi, which takes us to Zoar Garage, where I get on a mini-bus for the final part of the journey to school. We reach school at 8.45. School begins at 9 o'clock and finishes at 3.30, when we are taken home in the mini-bus. I get home at 4 o'clock, change into playing clothes, then ask Dad where the cows are. I take Driver, my collie, and if they are far I take my bike. When the cows are safe in the milking parlour yard I go in to play swing-ball. At 5.45 I feed the two farm dogs then have my own tea. Around 6.45 - 7.0 p.m. two of us drive the cows into the field. Then I have a bath and watch television until bed-time at 9.0 p.m.
